channel.title: Advantage of using native hardware over external midi?
channel.description:
Hi, I just got my Axoloti & it's incredible. Exactly what I was looking for so far.
I'm curious if soldering analog pots to the pins can/will yield a higher resolution than a 0-127 midi controller. What advantages are there in using native hardware to external midi other than freeing up a midi port?

item.title: Advantage of using native hardware over external midi?
item.dc:creator: @keyman Antonio Machado
item.description:
@keyman wrote:

this might help...

Midi and analog input (pots etc) Software implementation Software
Hi, First of all just wanted to say this is a great project. keep up the good work! Looking at buying my first core but first i have a few things i would like to clarify. Ok, so from what i understand you can assign a midi CC to a parameter to tweak in real time from a midi enabled input device. So when the core is running stand alone, you attach a midi knob bank to the hardware midi input of the core and tweak away.. ok cool. Now, if i were to add a hardware pot to the core, if i am corâ€¦

Read full topic

item.title: Advantage of using native hardware over external midi?

Sorry, you are correct, I was thinking internally. 7 bit v. 12 bit still stands though

item.title: Advantage of using native hardware over external midi?
item.dc:creator: @chidori
item.description:
@chidori wrote:

The gpio/in/analog object says it's 12-bit. Am I missing something / is there a higher res object within the patcher?

Read full topic
item.source: Advantage of using native hardware over external midi?

item.title: Advantage of using native hardware over external midi?
item.dc:creator: @fma matthew Allen
item.description:
@fma wrote:

The analog data has a considerably larger range (32 bit) so yeah, your resolution is going to be a bit higher than on midi (7 bit). I think this is the primary advantage of using the pins vs. midi.

Read full topic
item.source: Advantage of using native hardware over external midi?
